New Records: Alek Thomas became the sixth pinch-hitter to tie a game in LCS history with a home run.
Diamondbacks' bullpen performed effectively, contributing to their victory.
Key Match Events: A dramatic eighth-inning rally by Alek Thomas and Gabriel Moreno tied the game.
Trea Turner was caught stealing for the first time in 40 attempts, ending a streak.
Kevin Ginkel pitched a scoreless frame without a strikeout, showcasing effective bullpen management.
Pre-Game Insights: Diamondbacks used a bullpen game effectively, with Joe Mantiply as the opener.
Phillies starter Cristopher Sanchez struggled, forcing early use of the bullpen.
Post-Match Reflections: Diamondbacks' manager Torey Lovullo emphasized team resilience.
Closer Paul Sewald reflected on the electric atmosphere and the team's determination.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game saw 16 total pitchers, highlighting a bullpen-dominated contest.
The series was tied 2-2, setting up a crucial Game 5.
Diamondbacks had their fourth come-from-behind victory in the postseason.
Others: The game was the fourth time a pinch-hitter tied the LCS game since 1969.
Kyle Schwarber's home run was his 19th in the postseason, surpassing Reggie Jackson.
